|Intitle=Clinical iconography of a typical example of a vesicular eruption of the concha in favour of zoster PFP
|Description=Visualisation of vesicles in Ramsay Hunt's area pointing to zoster viral PFP
|Rubric=Multimedia content
|Contributors=
|Order=12}}
See the CEN website: www.cen-neurologie.fr where videos are available

properties.question: In the clinical iconography of a typical example of a vesicular eruption of the concha favoring zoster PFP, which area is indicated by the presence of vesicles?
properties.option_b: The cheek area, specifically Ramsay Hunt's area
properties.option_d: The occipital region at the back of the head
